website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a basic, budget-friendly cot, this military-style design fits the bill.
pros: Durable, dual cross-bar steel frame holds up to 300 pounds
Measures 75-inches long by 30-inches wide by 17-inches high
cons: The last crossbar can be a challenge to get in, but that tight fit is what keeps the cot supportive

website_summaries.verdict: For a sturdy flat spot to lay your head, this military-style cot is a good bet.
pros: Steel frame and longer 75-inch length made to hold larger adults
It provides a nice smooth surface to sleep on and space underneath to store your stuff
cons: Setup can be tricky with the last crossbar being a little difficult to put in place, but that helps make the cot sturdy

customer_reviews.title: I immediately put it together and like the other reviews found the last crossbar was a ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical after reading on the mixed reviews. I figured even if I got only one use for what I needed it for was worth it so I purchased it and within a couple days was at my doorstep. I immediately put it together and like the other reviews found the last crossbar was a bit difficult to lock into place, but seriously nothing a little muscle can't handle. The quality of the material as well as the carrying case I found to be very durable. Instructions can be found stitched on the inside flap of the carrying case, very handy. So worth my investment, glad I took the chance on it.
customer_reviews.author: 2blessed2Bstressed

customer_reviews.title: Very similar to what I used in the military. ...
customer_reviews.text: Very similar to what I used in the military. I was in the USMC for 21 years and we used a cot very similar to this. For those commenting about how hard it is to put the two bars on...it is supposed to be that way! This makes the cot tight and gives the support you need. Use something to pry it on.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Sieber

customer_reviews.title: Ugh. Worst trip of my life because of this item!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this once in May to go camping and I am camping right now. So this thing has had 2 uses. I am only 1 person and well under weight limit and the side lining completely ripped through. I am getting this figured out asap. I can't believe I don't not have a bed to sleep on anymore and it is now 2am on a Sunday. Thanks a lot Coleman. Update: the next morning I took pictures and my back has been killing me from that cross bar since I woke up laying directly on it.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Bryan

customer_reviews.title: I'm around 280 pounds and this thing works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: No more deflating air mattresses anymore. I'm around 280 pounds and this thing works like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Hare

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Terribly made cot, uncomfortable, and small. I wasn't expecting great comfort from a camping cot, but after using the thing for 3 days it starting ripping and I was laying on the metal bars that support the frame. Worse yet I missed the return deadline due to being out of state camping and now I'm stuck with it. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: judith

customer_reviews.title: Second crossbar could not lock in place
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this item, as even after trying hard along with my family members I could not lock the second cross bar in place. I bought this for my son who is a boy scout and 13 years old. If the assembly is not easy enough for him then he will not be able to use it when camping. It looks like I am either making a very dumb mistake assembling it, or the fabric somehow is coming one inch short in length when trying to lock the second crossbar in place. Coleman has not provided any printed assembly instructions or videos either, so that doesn't help.
customer_reviews.author: SUHAS MUTATKAR

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap, broken cot(s)
customer_reviews.text: We bought these a couple months ago in anticipation of our big 8 day family camping trip. We got in late last night, our kids were exhausted, we were exhausted. Got the tents set up and took these out of the bag (never opened) and the pegs at the end to attach the side bars were broken on 2 out of the 3 we purchased. Not happy, and will never purchase these again. And of course I am past the return window. Piece of crap for an expensive cot that is broken and will be thrown away before we leave.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha Joachim

customer_reviews.title: Good cot, you better be strong to put it together.
customer_reviews.text: Good solid, comfortable cot at a great price. You need to be strong to put it together. Some people won't be strong enough. For them, this is zero star cot. For me, it's a brief struggle with assembly for which I am rewarded with a great cot for a good night's sleep. These cots are heavy, you won't want to carry one far. Camp near the car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cot 4 Big People
customer_reviews.text: If you're oversized, this is the way to go Yeah, so I'm a big guy. In all directions. I'm kinda tall and I'm wide and I'm totin' some tonnage, so you wonder whether this thing is up to the task. It is. For us biggins, the extra width of this is welcome, the length is nice, and it's pretty comfortable. It's also easy to setup and foldup. I used it for about 15 nights last summer and so far so good. We'll see how well the springs hold up over time, but I'm optimistic so far. If you're oversized, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Stitch

customer_reviews.title: It was incredibly useful. We did had issues hitting our shins on ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put in the room with my terminally ill mom so that myself and her partner could take turns sleeping in there with her and her hospital bed. It was incredibly useful. We did had issues hitting our shins on the sides of the ends but we wrapped socks around it and fixed that issue. Also, we added a mattress topper and twin sheets and it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Hughey

customer_reviews.title: The weakest link
customer_reviews.text: My cot came damaged right out of the box. Good thing to. It might have been years before it broke since I don't camp that often and then I would have been stuck with a damaged cot. When I tried to put it together I couldn't because one of the corner plastic pins for the cross bar was broken. This is a shame because Coleman is usually known for quality camp gear. Looks like I am not the first owner of this specific cot. Maybe the last guy weight more than 300 Lbs or maybe its not really made to hold 300 Lbs. These corner pins should be made of metal NOT plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C. Michalides

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk - two broken out of the box - plastic part needs to be stronger
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these from amazon warehouse. Both were broken out of the box. OK, maybe they had been returned because they were broken, but it's clear that a critical part is poorly designed. There is a horizontal crossbar at the head and the foot of the cot that keeps the cot in tension. It clips into little plastic nubs at the end of the frame. The problem is that these plastic nubs are fragile and break easily, rendering the cot useless.
customer_reviews.author: DDC

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 years with minimal use.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these for me and my son in Aug 2016. We have used them probably 10 times since then. My son has stopped using them, so I would just grab whichever one was closest in our camping gear. They have always been stored in our garage, and have always been stores in their bags. They both ripped in consecutive campouts. One in March, and then one this weekend (May). Both ripped on the seams. For being such a heavy and supposedly durable product, it should have lasted a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly R.

customer_reviews.title: Important parts are cheaply made and Coleman warranty response is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: This product was broken upon arrival. It was purchased in winter for anticipated use in the warmer months. When going to use it the first time, an end cap was broken. Unfortunately, the end caps on this product are plastics, but are to hold the very important cross bar to support your head and legs. Coleman continues delaying the response to their warranty. I think the product may work well but this flaw in the design is definitely an issue they need to fix - in addition to their slow response. The product gets a star because it looks useful and is easy to assemble. More stars would be given had it actually be usable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie stoltz

customer_reviews.title: Flaw..plastic piece!!
customer_reviews.text: Where the crossbars attach to the cot. A plastic piece is used. This will break!! Too bad..it would have been a comfortable cot otherwise. Hopefully Coleman will replace with a steel piece instead of plastic..
customer_reviews.author: Backpacker67

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I have two other cots from Adventure Ridge (Aldi's brand?). This Coleman cot is way sturdier, wider, and more robust. It's is way easier to setup with the way the bar and pins work, and actually folds down smaller and easier to fit back in the bag. The canvas isn't so tight when it's assembled that it's like sleeping on a board, more like a very tight hammock. Very comfortable and big enough for a 185lb 6' guy.
customer_reviews.author: autumn

customer_reviews.title: The cot is super firm. I’m pretty strong but was unable to ...
customer_reviews.text: So I just got it and used it once. The cot is super firm. I’m pretty strong but was unable to get that last peg in yet. However it didn’t effect my sleeping. I just slid last bar in, put one peg in hole and laid other side of bar on top. The carry bag ripped instantly so that was pretty useless. Definitely felt secure under my weight. So far I’d get it again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Farrugia

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Cots don't set up properly and may tear
customer_reviews.text: Really frustrated with this purchase. The fabric was too rigid and taught to secure the ends without substantial effort. And then, after only three uses, one of the cots we purchased has a tear near a seam. That's with just occasional use! It feels like such a waste of money. These cots are either defective or have a bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba Jo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the Price
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our bottom of the line Coleman cots with these. AMAZING! They are a little difficult to put together, but I am sure they will get easier with use. My kids slept on them for a week and camp. They said they could not believe the difference. They were great! I think we could have paid twice as much and not been any happier with the product! We now own 4 of these cots and are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hester

customer_reviews.title: Junk, ashamed at Coleman. It used to stand for something.
customer_reviews.text: Cot ripping first use. Im no where near the reported max weight. Easy to set up, thats the 2 stars, the rest is a 0 star. Junk, ashamed at Coleman. It used to stand for something.
customer_reviews.author: Emoore

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy cot!
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased two of these cots for our teenage sons and they're great! We were so satisfied with them that when my nephew needed one, we didn't hesitate to order one for him! There are end braces that have to be threaded through the material, which prove to be quite 'tight' to get into the correct locking position of the frame. We found that as the material stretches slightly, it allows for an easier assembly of these braces. Our nephew isn't strong enough to do this on his own, but he's enjoying the cot, just the same! We're all HAPPY CAMPERS!
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy but tricky to set up
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Light, easy to carry. More comfortable than an inflatable mattress after you add blankets, etc. Cons: The last bar is really difficult to snap in place. I watched a youtube video which helped me finally figure it out. I am a pretty strong female but I really struggled. It took me a good 30 almost 40 mins to finally maneuver the last bar in place in a yoga-meets hulk type gesture. I was so proud I got it in that in that I am now terrified to take it apart afraid fearful that ill never be able to get it back together..... Lost a star for that
customer_reviews.author: NYC10

customer_reviews.title: Fabric failure. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: In less than one season of outdoor exposure the polyester fabric deteriorated to the point of ripping and uselessness. This may be UV exposure. Yet, one would think that this cot would be expected to withstand outdoor use. Metal frame is fine.
customer_reviews.author: KgF

customer_reviews.title: Best camping accessory!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cot! It’s used for camping with us, and it is very sturdy. It’s the perfect length for my 5 ft 8 frame, and it was very easy for me to put together on my own. It helps a lot to be raised off the ground because of the constant rain here (Hawai’i). There is a carrying case with an arm strap. The side bars aren’t too hard to pop into place, and it gets easier after the first few times because you get the hang of it. The fabric is tight, but also has enough give to make sleeping pretty comfortable. Terrific buy for the quality and frequent use!
customer_reviews.author: Nicki

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, bulky, and need super human strength to add bars.  Not happy
customer_reviews.text: This weighs about 40lbs, to get the cross bars on I had to ask a stranger to help, and he struggled, while sitting down my leg was pinched between metal frame and fabric. It’s not a convenient cot. If you want something you can carry into a campsite, this isn’t it. It’s heavy! Also the bars on top and bottom Stick out about 4” which is prime for hitting leg on it in the dark. So unhappy. I just used it for the first time, on August 31st-September 2nd. Went in to amazon to try and return it and the return window was closed. Ive had it a month.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Jeffries

customer_reviews.title: Solid camping cot
customer_reviews.text: Not the most comfortable, but you can add a mattress pad or something similar. Very solid. Sits about a foot and a half to two feet off the ground so you can have an easier time putting your shoes on when you have to make a late night restroom run. Putting the foot-end bar on does take some muscle. It's easier if you have 2 people doing it. But, if alone, I find it easier if you place your foot on the bar and push/guide with your leg. Using that method it took me a few seconds. I like this cot and will be using it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfman22

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Capacity Issues
customer_reviews.text: This cot is inexpensive compared to many of the competitors. The description says it supports up to 300 pounds. If you weigh more than 200 pounds you need to use this item with care or the legs are likely to buckle. My teens (about 6ft, 230 pounds) have broken the legs on two. The item that I received from my most recent order shipped with an endcap broken off on each end so I can't install the end bars. There wasn't any obvious damage to the boxes so I didn't notice until we went to use it two weeks past the return deadline.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: The fold up military style cot works great for camping. I see other reviewers complaining that the cot is too heavy for hiking and camping and they are correct. This cot is not intended for carrying with you. It is quite hefty and sturdy. But ideal for using inside your tent if you can drive to your camping spot. I would purchase again as a sleeping cot. But advise against attempting to use it as a hiking cot.
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: The quality must vary a bit because with the cot ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality must vary a bit because with the cot I received, the second metal bar is impossible to put on without ripping the stitching. I read people saying you just need to use some muscle, I think they are assuming all the cots are the same as theirs. Mine needed a bit more than "some muscle". I had to apply so much force that it ripped the stitching out. It's still usable and not worth the hassle of returning. If I had to do it again I would just buy some foam to put under me and sleep on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great! Sturdy! Comfy! :-)——- Heavy :-(
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy and comfy cot however, it is heavy and maybe even bulky to carry around. I got it for camping and if we have an over night guest they can have a choice between an inflatable mattress or this cot. I prefer this cot. I wanted one more like a gravity chair but there was none available at the time and I needed it. I really like it and I do recommend it. Again this is heavy and bulky to carry. But it’s sturdy and comfy. Also be careful setting it up make sure you don’t get your fingers pinched :-0
customer_reviews.author: Edgaba

customer_reviews.title: No quality control look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Worst buy ever on Amazon the two metal bars that go on the end almost impossible to put on I had to really man handle them to get the last one on and then it looked like cupids bow on both ends so that tells me that they cut the fabric way too short the pictures of the cot do not show the ends bowed inwards I bought a different brand b-4 and the ends were snug .. but the ones on this one looked like they were ready to snap should have taken a picture anyway I can't recommend this cot due to lack of quality control on the fabric sizing
customer_reviews.author: K. MARTIN

customer_reviews.title: Bigger then I thought.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for tent camping. Much bigger then I thought they’d be. I use my foot and legs to muscle end bars in place. The cots are very strong and very tight. Not the most comfortable, but with a sleeping pad they work good. We take them camping and we have three that take up half the room of a ten man tent. So they are pretty big. But we just put our bags underneath for storage. The kids like them, keeps them in one place instead of rolling all over the place. If buying again I’d probably look for something smaller, however that was my fault not checking the size. Decent product. Very strong, and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kandace Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Annoying
customer_reviews.text: Want to get into a huge fight with your significant other? Buy this cot and try to put it together. It will turn a mild-mannered poet into a screaming jerk! I have used so many cots that do not require TWO people to pop them open. There are these two bars that need to be placed through a fabric loop and then snapped over two notches. This is an impossible task. NOT POSSIBLE. Hey, guess what else? No instructions! Just a really heavy bag with a bulky metal thing inside that is guaranteed to annoy or infuriate you.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this cot
customer_reviews.text: This cot is difficult when trying to get the end bars attached and requires two people. We've used it a few times and often leave one end unattached. The end bars extend out quite a bit beyond the cot and have very sharp corners. We have covered them with duct tape so no one will get scraped. Disappointed as we have quite a few Coleman camping products and other Coleman cots.
customer_reviews.author: Rascal

customer_reviews.title: We did set them up and tried them in the basement and they are great. The only thing we had a problem with ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars, but, as we got them at Christmas, and have not camped with them yet. We did set them up and tried them in the basement and they are great. The only thing we had a problem with was setting the last bar that stretches the fabric. I solved that problem with a short piece of an old broom handle. It was just maybe the first time, so we will see. I am keeping the handle in the bag with the cot, so it is no big deal, can not wait for some warm weather to get out there and camp. They would make a good spare bed if needed.
customer_reviews.author: James N. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, Sturdy Cot
customer_reviews.text: I have back problems and can't sleep on a regular mattress. I got this to keep me off the floor (I live in Texas and you will get at least one roach in your house during the summertimes rains no matter what you do) and I layered a mat about an inch or two thick on top. It's really sturdy- a little heavy hauling up my narrow stair case but it went together pretty easily and once it's all set up moving it around is easy. I sleep on it every night and it's held up very well and is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Caite Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Frame and Easy Setup.
customer_reviews.text: Performed well. The cot is heavy and sturdy. Performed great when used 50 pounds over the recommended weight. I would recommend laying down a protective barrier on your tent floor so not to damage the tent. The storage bag could be a bit bigger and the tie string is lightweight. The tie string on my storage bag immediately broke, as the string is super lightweight. This is a small inconvenience and easy fix for a really nice, comfortable, and affordable cot. I highly recommend this product for it's durability and easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: The crossbar may put up a fight.
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the other reviews. The hardest part is snapping in the last crossbar which you must do, otherwise it will collapse when you lay down. It took me 4 days to get the last crossbar in place. I weigh 117 lbs and just recovering from ‘starvation mode’ so I don’t have a lot of muscle tone. Exasperated I gave it one more try using a sturdy screwdriver as a leverage. It worked, and the crossbar popped right in place. Comfortable and roomy and you are off the floor. I store it on its side, not taking it apart. It’s a great product, very sturdy, lightweight, easy to move around and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Not easy
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two of these, and were never able to fully secure one side. We read all the reviews and figured if we need to use a little muscle to have a nice cot experience then we would go for it. Not only did I try, my husband try, all of our friends on our last trip, NONE of us could get the bars to fit. No way to return so we finally just tossed them. None of our friends wanted to take them either, and most of us in our friend group are lushes for free camping gear. But this is gear even I wouldn’t take if he was being offered for free.
customer_reviews.author: A. Young

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The cot is STURDY. The end bars fit snugly across the ends. We had to use a metal bar to leverage the end bar into place where it attaches to the supporting side bars. Once together the canvas material stretches nicely to be firm when laying on the cot. It's simple to fold up and unfolding. No directions necessary. We're going camping and this will keep us high enough off the ground (16") for good air circulation, we can place gear under the cot for needed storage. space. Coleman did it again with great quality!
customer_reviews.author: BABs

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for for my son to use on our frequent camping trips. It's well made, sturdy, and held up well on our weekend trip. I didn't give it the full 5 stars because 1) the material is so tight we couldn't get both end bars to lock in place even with 2 adult men pulling on it and 2) having to load the cot through the end of the bag is kind of difficult. I personally have a Rio cot and their bag has a side zipper which makes it much easier to take out and put away. Overall, it's a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: tat2dangelinaz

customer_reviews.title: Harder than the floor.
customer_reviews.text: The cot is VERY sturdy but I eventually decided I was better off on the floor because it was softer. There are bars on either end that pull the fabric taunt and even with two people pulling we couldn’t get the foot piece in place, so it was never really together correctly and was still hard as a rock. Also noticed, and I think the mesh of the cot came into play, couldn’t get warm under 3 blankets in a 70°F office. The cold came up from the bottom. Might be okay with some kind of heavy duty mat on top but it’s more of a survival only cot (if you’re not transporting it- it’s heavy!)
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, but heavy and a bit rough.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value item. It is heavy, about 19lbs, but if you are car camping, it is not an issue. It is pretty sturdy but does sway length wise a bit if you flop around at night, but nothing to be concerned. I am 250lbs and it has held up just fine. The biggest gripe I have is that this thing can flat bite you when you a folding it up. It is no different than any other folding cot out there, but the lighter ones are a bit easier to manage. Overall, for ~$40, no real complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jason N.

customer_reviews.title: don't order more than one
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these and the one that was shipped as a single was great- but the ones that were sent in a double box were crushed and parts of the cots were broken to the point that we couldn't use them and I returned them. The one that did work- It gave us a lot more room in the tent and it was easy to get dressed and put shoes on etc. Not as comfy as my bed, but a lot better than waking up on a flat air mattress. I would buy these again- but maybe not through amazon because of the shipping.
customer_reviews.author: HuntFam

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but the bag isn’t great
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I would have given 5 stars but when I put the cot back to its bag and zipped it, the retainer broke and the bag was also torn off by unknown reason... the manufacture focused on the main product but forgot other minor things. My item now can’t be secured if I every bring it onto an outdoor trip. Other than that, the cot is very nice, well machined. The edge of the legs aren’t sharp. The 2 bars that uses to stretch the canvas was designed with a extra length, which is very nice so the users can easily pull it.
customer_reviews.author: THE TRANs

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Gave it a 4 because when you assemble it, it is really hard to get the last rod (end rod) in place. You have to pull really hard and no lie, my nephew who’s a body builder even struggled. Other than that, it is very sturdy once assembled and once the end rod is off, farily easy to take down and pack.
customer_reviews.author: Ceci

customer_reviews.title: Struggled to Put Together
customer_reviews.text: This cot is frick’n heavy!!!! I bought this for my mom for when we go camping, but she couldn’t even lift the carry case to carry it to the tent. It was very difficult to assemble the end pieces. Good thing that my brother happened to be with us and had some tools and muscle. Even he struggled with the final piece. There is no way we could put this together nor disassemble it if it was just my mom and I. We are pretty tough gals when the time calls for us to be, but this was beyond our level of toughness.
customer_reviews.author: N. Jones

customer_reviews.title: difficult to set up. bag too small and drawstring broke.
customer_reviews.text: The cot itself has a durable bed and the frame seems relatively strong, however the pins on the tensioning bars that have to enter into a hole in the frame takes a lot of strength. My 13 year old will need help on his scout trip. The carry bag is also too small. The bag does not fully close over the frame, leaving an opening and the draw string, as well as the spring tensioner on the string both broke on the first pull. This could be a good product with a little more fabric on the bag and stronger string/tensioner. After some use, I am hoping the bars will become a bit easier to put in place.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great for a big fella!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6' 1" and 265 lbs. This cot works perfectly for me - plenty of room and no worries that I'm going to fall through the thing! I added an air mattress to the top and its super-comfortable. Be aware that the size and sturdiness come at a price - this thing weights a ton! Since we car-camp, the weigh is not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Some came defective
customer_reviews.text: We ended up buying several of these cots since we liked the first one. They are easy to put together and have a great bag that they fit in for storage. One came without a cross piece and two came with damaged pegs that are essential in putting them together so we will be exchanging them. Otherwise they were really good. Several women slept on them for a retreat and most were happy. A few said they were alittle hard, but we had yoga mats we placed on top which took care of that issue.
customer_reviews.author: M. kauer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to set up
customer_reviews.text: We have used this cot several times and have not been able to set it up completely. It is extremely difficult to get the last corner connected. So much strength is needed or we don't know what we are doing to attach the last cross bar to the side bar. Even without that connected, the cot is taut and my son has been able to use it. He said it work fine. I checked it a few times during his use and I couldn't see any lack of tautness. It has been a good cot for us.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ulbricht

customer_reviews.title: Will not assemble
customer_reviews.text: The crossbars at either end will not fit on the cot at the same time. The fabric is not long enough. I used a pry bar to try and wrestle it on. It physically will not stretch that far. Other people have complained about the same thing and said that using a lot of strength can get the second cross bar on - Not this one. I was afraid I was going to injure myself.I don't know if this is bad quality control or bad design. It doesn't matter, the thing is complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Marisol

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me and I'm 285 lb and 6 ft tall
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6ft tall and 285 lbs. This product works well for me. Once it's together, it's sturdy and strong. It's comfortable to sleep on and sitting on the edge doesn't cause the product to twist or feel weak. If there could be a complaint, it's putting the two cross bars in when setting up can be a little difficult. This may be because the product is new and the fabric is still tight. Perhaps the cross members being somewhat difficult is what makes this product strong and sturdy. Regardless I would recommend to others and I would buy again if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Beverley

customer_reviews.title: Very good cot but again, final step is never easy
customer_reviews.text: always difficult with the final step for a cot...when putting the support rail into the tube canvas at one end, the rail has a small hole at each end and needs to snap it on to the bed. this pulls the canvas tight. getting the first 3 hole to snap it on is easy but the final step to get the last hole to snap is another story. hell, i can't do it. hard for a female. have a guy do it. my bf had to sit and use his foot to push the support rail forward to line it up just to get it to snap it on. in the end, one decent cot and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy cot.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a few times when we car camp. Reminds me of the old army cots my dad had for camping. It is very tight and can be a challenge to pull that final cross bar into place. Very sturdy construction. It is very tight and I still use one of my self-inflating backpack mattresses on it to soften up. Still much better than sleeping on the ground and as I get older getting up off the ground. Took a while to get used to how it folds up, but once you get the hang of it breaks down pretty fast.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bowles

customer_reviews.title: Not 35 Inches Wide!
customer_reviews.text: The cot I received is just under 30 inches wide (about 29 3/4"), which is still OK for me as I'm not a big guy. It does say 35 inches wide (global), whatever that means, on the label, which must be why it says as much in Amazon's description. Height from the ground is 16", and length is 74 1/2". The cot was easy to unfold and set up, comes with a carrying case, and appears sturdy enough to throw in the back of the jeep, so despite the unexpected smaller width, I'll be keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick in Northern AZ

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I'll probably change my review if I get no response from Coleman, due to the cross bars not being included in my order! My husband leaves to the field in a few days so it was kind of a bummer. It was nice that all you really had to do was open it up from it's folded position, and attach the cross bars. I can't say how easy or hard the cross bars are to attach since we didn't receive them. He laid on it and it was sturdy enough to hold him up. He's 6'1" and 215lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Liza

customer_reviews.title: Great products
customer_reviews.text: The product is good except it arrived damaged and unfortunately I did not have time I had to unpack it at the campsite and that's when I discovered the button for the End Rod at the head or footboard was pushed in all the way and I couldn't get it to come out it's jammed in there but unfortunately I was already camping so I had to use it as it was I was unable to return it for a replacement Coleman products are absolutely wonderful their quality control is great so this really surprises me this is the first product I've ever received it wasn't perfect
customer_reviews.author: deborahpenn

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy cot that will fit an adult comfortably. Excellent quality. The crossbars can be a bit difficult to set in place but for is necessary to keep the tarp tight. Note that the crossbars are longer on one side than the other, I'd recommend puttin the longer ones on the same side. The only complaint we had was that we kept running into the longer part that was sticking out. They need to be long for leverage but we still have some bruised chins.
customer_reviews.author: krisristen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I returned the cot. It seemed to be made well. It did squeak a little when I sat on it. Material seemed strong. The cloth is on a frame and you insert a bar to each end to pull the fabric tight. I could not get the second bar in place. I messed with it for a while, pinched my fingers, and used some 4 letter words. I can’t imagine trying to set up camp and messing with this for 30 minutes to set it up. I’ll pay more for something that is easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy2008TX

customer_reviews.title: Major Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: This cot has several major flaws: 1) the fabric was so tight, it took all my husband’s strength to get the ends in place. When he finally did, the end bars were bending. 2) the fabric was so tight, it made the bed like the top of a drum. It was stiff as a board. 3) The end bars stuck out away from the cot, Making them a hazard for scraping your legs. 4) the end bars are so tight that, unless your careful when assembling/disassembling you’ll pinch your fingers, and it will be bad.
customer_reviews.author: KiraJAndersen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy cot
customer_reviews.text: We bought this cot as a guest bed for our kids friends. It’s very sturdy and comfortable enough for a sleepover. I especially like that it’s pretty compact - slips into any crowded closet. One draw back is if you’re fairly tall- let’s say 5’7” or so it’s going to be a bit too short.
customer_reviews.author: SKY1999

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, bulky, difficult to assemble, with questionable longevity
customer_reviews.text: First, and foremost, this thing is heavy. The cinch on the carry can't actually close the end of the bag as the material is too thick and the cord too scrawny. The trim around the edge of the material around one of the leg connections split off after one use by a 7 year old and I suspect the unfinished material edge will now fray appart. Even as deal of the day I can't recommend one of these. It is reasonably comfortable, but there are too many trade offs.
customer_reviews.author: A. Williams

customer_reviews.title: A great cot, although a little tough to set up
customer_reviews.text: We just purchased an additional cot, after owning and enjoying the first for a couple years. The design of the cot is simple, but it is not especially easy to set up the cross bars; it takes a good amount of strength to stretch them over the knobs and pull them into place. I'm not completely out of shape, but I still ended up bruising my arms something fierce (and maybe letting out a few grumbles), just getting set up. Break down was a little easier, thankfully. So, if you don't have much strength or mobility in your upper body, I would be wary of selecting this particular model. For the money, though, it's a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley B.

customer_reviews.title: That final bar though...
customer_reviews.text: The item is sturdy and great for camping or foe extra sleeping options. Very compact when folded up and stored, but also when unfolded and in use. However, it is very difficult to get the final stabilizing bar locked into place. I had to leverage my back against the wall and then use my feet on the cot as counter leverage, while my son was on the other end holding onto the cot. It took way longer than it should have. Easy to breakdown though.
customer_reviews.author: C. Green

customer_reviews.title: The best cot ever!
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed one of these for a guest. This takes a bit of strength to get it put up, but it works so amazingly well. It is really comfortable. I love the top and bottom bars because this helps for it to not sag. So I bought one for my house, and my guests and grandkids love it. It is well made and sturdy. I think it will last years. It is easy to store. I might buy more. It is much easier to store than mattresses. I was concerned that the legs would ruin a tent but my friends use it all the time and they have never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: The most important structural piece on this is the end caps, and they're made out of cheap plastic. Arrived broken and from the way it is bundled up not likely that it happened in shipping. They could have used metal for that piece and this would be nearly indestructible, instead they saved 4 cents and you get something guaranteed to break eventually. This is why I avoid Coleman products anymore, they skimp on quality in dumb ways that tarnish their reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Shadeofdeath

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping Soundly
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I weigh about 165 and have been using this for most of the month. So far, no issues. It's well padded and well covered, so I'm quite warm and comfortable on it. For the money, I could not go wrong. The one tough part was putting the second cross bar into place. I used a foot, but then resorted to a large, very large, screwdriver I had on hand (a small crowbar would have done as well). Once set up. I loved it. Still do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This cot is a bit tough to set up due to how tight the fabric is but it results in a nice taut cot. Unfortunately, I've had it 3 months, used it 4 times and the fabric split along the seam. I only weigh 140 pounds so I know I didn't overstress it. Poor quality has resulted in a worthless product in a short amount of time. I'll try another brand next. Coleman products aren't what they used to be. Updated to add new photos.
customer_reviews.author: NotYou

customer_reviews.title: Can't get the 2nd crossbar on.
customer_reviews.text: Ok... I just got this today and I am sending it back STAT. I literally cannot get the 2nd crossbar on no matter how hard I pull, push, twist, contort or stick my tongue out in just the right way. It is NOT going on. I ordered this one for my son and a different Coleman cot for myself that was $15.00 more. Mine is WAY easier to put together and has the added benefit of a side table and cup holder. I would rather pay the extra $15.00 and get the other one for him. This thing is beyond ridiculous! Arnold Swarzennegar probably couldn't get this bar on here.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Pomeroy

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with this cot especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cot for a great price. It is easy to set up and is very sturdy. I tried a couple of my friends more expensive folding cots without the tension bars and I actually like this one better. It is fairly low but I like that because I can sit on the edge of the cot without the bar digging into the back of my legs to get up or put my shoes on. The carry bag is also a sturdy material. My friend had bought one from amazon and when it was put away it tore the carry bag open.
customer_reviews.author: DTMFM

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE TIME AND CASH!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely difficult to put the end bars on and near impossible to fit back in the carry bag. Requires immense strength to assemble. Poorly designed hardware tore the edge immediately. Stitching is amateur at best and uneven like quality was of no concern. If I had any strength left to disassemble it and a helping hand for a few hours to try shoving it back in the bag, I'd return it asap but doubt is see a refund for the condition it's in. Guess I'll take a loss.
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: arrived broken 0/5
customer_reviews.text: There are small dimples on each side that holds the slack in the canvas material. Mine arrived broken out of the box. Unfortunately for me I need it for a camping trip and cannot return it in time. It will be usable but very disappointing as the canvas will be loose and the feet area will just be left to dangle. On top of that it weighs a lot. Hardly a good camping bed as it would take a sled or quad to travel with it.
customer_reviews.author: lord drast

customer_reviews.title: Unable to setup
customer_reviews.text: I received the cot and attempted to unfold it. It was sturdy and appeared to be made with good materials. However, the frame was so tight along with the fabric that I couldn't get it to snap into place. Online videos say you really have to muscle it. I'm a grown man around 200 pounds, in good physical shape, and I STRUGGLED. At one point I used a metal broom handle to try and pry the final bar to snap into place. The bar bent. I sent it back and got a refund. The design is not perfected yet.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Reed

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy cot, can be hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty sturdy cot. Better than sleeping on the ground but you may want a mat on top if you want real comfort. Putting in the second support bar is a little bit of a hassle because there is a lot of resistance. I have to use my legs to push against the cross bars while I pull the bar into place. Also, you have to watch out for the two poles on the top and bottom. They stick out some and are easy to ram your legs into if you aren't careful.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had read the reviews more carefully.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read more of the reviews before I purchased it. We had a really hard time putting the last bar on it. We stood it upright and stepped on the last side and FINALLY manuvered it into place. Hoping with use, it will get easier. And It's definately more than 18 lbs. tried to send it back but Fed Ex wanted $47 to ship it. Decided to keep it and just deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Trish L.

customer_reviews.title: Not Expensive and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have had my eye on a few cots for quite awhile, but didn't want to spend a lot of money on something I'd use only a few times a year. The cot is easy to unfold and put together - there are 2 bars which go through the head and foot rests and require a bit of arm strength to get them to stretch in place properly. It fits comfortably in a 4 person tent, but I wouldn't try it with anything smaller as it was just small enough not to press out the sides. It sits about a foot off the ground so it allows for some added storage space for bags too.
customer_reviews.author: Zita

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective...Quick to setup!
customer_reviews.text: A little on the heavy side and a bit of a struggle to get the last beam on...I could see why women would struggle with this unit...I recommend setting up the last beam on the legs side...But I love its simplicity and heavy duty construction. Very comfortable and you can sleep straight on the vinyl although I did get a pad to complement it, but sleeping straight on it is very recommended also since it is soft and supportive...
customer_reviews.author: Mario Ghecea

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these. One arrived with the plastic ends shattered so that it couldn't be put together because the plastic end hook into the stretcher bar. The one that wasn't broken was extremely hard to put together. Even with the help of my 15-yo son, who is pretty strong it was a challenge. I'm a single mom of three so this is way more work than I'd like if we're camping alone. I went with an Osage river cot instead that was a bit pricier but same sturdiness and way easier to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Krista K. Paredes

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy cot for setting up a sleeping area. not too heavy, but I would really hate to have to carry this thing on a multiple day hike. Really good for an office cot or extra sleeping space when the relatives are in town. Getting it together is a little challenging as the frame relies on tension to provide support for the sleeping area and you have struggle a bit to get the last strut in place because of that tension. Provides good back support. I purchased this with a small matress top. Would be good to you with a sleeping bag as well.
customer_reviews.author: James Verwilliams

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a couple months. Used a handful of times and it ripped at the seams already
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fabric is too short.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a set of these for over a year. The fabric has never stretched out enough to secure the foot(or head) bar. I can always get one on but the opposite bar cant reach the pegs. I've used them a few times and just keep the bottom bar detached. It's sad because I do love Coleman products dearly and never had an issue until these cots.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: You better be strong...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice cot. It comes with a carrying bag that it fits nicely into. My 10yr old figured out how to assemble it without trouble... until you had to insert the end pieces at the head and foot. I am in good shape, and still had to have my husband put the ends in. They were impossible for me to put together, I simply wasn't strong enough. I'd have given 5 stars if I could have assembled it without help!
customer_reviews.author: Amy E

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good value.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a similar REI cot I've had for years, needed another cot. This Coleman was far less expensive than my REI cot but seems like good quality. These cots can be a struggle to set up because it takes some muscle to stretch them enough to get the last end spar in., but the nice drum-tight sleeping surface is worth it. If I use my Lightspeed pad on top I'm every bit as comfortable as in my bed at home.
customer_reviews.author: thefixr

customer_reviews.title: Firm and sturdy cot.
customer_reviews.text: Firm and sturdy cot. Solid construction. Great support. Add a foam pad and a pillow and you could seriously sleep in this for days. Size is great too, comfortably fits anyone up to 6’1. Slept 2 nights on it and it withheld my 265 lbs! When you put in the 2nd cross bar, it helps to stand it up so you'll have more leverage to attach it to the cot. Quality of this cot is very good. I'd expect it to last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: J.M. Torres

customer_reviews.title: Great little cot!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this solely to avoid an extra bed fee at the hotel for our daughter, who loved sleeping on it. This sturdy cot has paid for itself in three nights stay! It's easy to put together with two people. There are two cross bars that have to be inserted to provide structural tension which could be difficult without help. It folds up easily and goes readily into its storage bag. This is a great cot for adults too, as it's rated for over 250 pounds, and was worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: JENERIC

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable cot for a good price
customer_reviews.text: The cot was very easy to set up. I haven’t taken it down yet but I’m assuming it will be just as easy to pack up. Last bar is a bit tough to connect because the cot is tight but is manageable for one person. Cot is comfortable for what it is. I’m 6’1 which is about the height limit if you sleep on your back. Head and heels are right at the ends. It’s wide enough so you could sleep on your side.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cot , for its cost.
customer_reviews.text: A less expensive version of the classic GI cot. These are steel framed not aluminum. They also lack the large holes on the corners of the two draw bars. They have the assembly holes. The missing ones would have held the 1 inch X 30 inch wooden poles / frame that support the GI bug net. Still a very rugged use cot. Yes. The second draw bar is difficult to pull into place. Do yourself a favor and make a cheater out of some tubing that will slide over the longer end of the draw bar. 6-10 inches will give you the leverage to snap the draw bar onto its locking stud.
customer_reviews.author: Woodrow01

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews of stitching failure on this cot, I was apprehensive. I ordered anyway and I have slept on it twice since it arrived. I'm sure it will meet my needs. The only disappointment is that the carry bag arrived with a tear in it. I don't want to return the cot so I can have a new carry bag. Is there a way for me to exchange ONLY the carry bag. I have until 11/21/2019 to make a return/exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Mavourneen Davis

customer_reviews.title: Comfy for a Cot
customer_reviews.text: I tested this out at home before our next camping trip. Found it to be very sturdy, easy to set up, and very comfortable for a cot. Setup was just popping in two horizontal bars at the end. It folds up into a package not much bigger than a collapsible chair and comes in a sturdy bag. I pared it with an inflatable mat and found it nice to sleep on. It is heavy, so I wouldn't use it for back packing.
customer_reviews.author: MrTripps

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I like it as well as I could like any cot. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because no cot is as comfortable as a good mattress and box spring. However, in comparing apples to apples and oranges to oranges, this cot is the best I have ever slept on. It is wider than a standard cot and supports my 300 lbs. just fine. It is sturdy and gives me the confidence I can sit in the middle and put on my shoes without feeling like I am about to be caught in a giant mouse trap. Sturdy as can be but too heavy to take back packing
customer_reviews.author: Autowood

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great in combination with a sleeping pad and sleeping bag very comfortable. The one star down is that it broke at the start of my very first camping trip with it. The end bar bent so I couldn't attach the bar on one end. Thankfully I'm short and didn't need the cot to be that long, it was just disappointing that it broke so easily and quickly. Compact and lightweight design easy to set up break down. About the size of a folded camping chair when in its bag.
customer_reviews.author: Nica Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction. Great support. Very comfortable to sleep on.
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction. Great support. Very comfortable to sleep on. A bit heavy - I would consider it a bit too heavy to carry around if walking any significant distance with it. We got two and the first one was easily assembled, the second one was impossible to fit the side bar on and we ended up returning the second one. We are still using the first one and very happy with it. Maybe their manufacturing process is not consistent. But the quality is good enough to take a chance on it considering Amazon customer service is awesome and will take returns if it has any issues.
customer_reviews.author: WRXster

customer_reviews.title: Cot for HULK
customer_reviews.text: You're going to need some extreme muscle to put this thing together. However, once it's assembled its incredibly sturdy. My 12 year old giant tossed and turned (that's just who she is as a person) on it all night and it held up. My 5 year old jumped on it (because she thinks she is a tiny gangster that the rules don't apply to... she's probably right) and it didn't collapse. Comfortable enough to go camping, (or sneaking an extra person into a hotel) but let's be real here... it's a cot, not a palace.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan Stuckey

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: I never got a chance to use this cot because I purchased a “Used Very Good” one from the warehouse and realized immediately upon first assembly that 2 of the 4 pieces necessary to attach the end bars to the rest of the frame were broken off. You can’t attach them properly (and therefore also cannot stretch the cot fabric to full tension) without those broken pieces (see photos). Returning for a refund and will be purchasing a different brand/style because the broken bits served as a warning to me that this is a design flaw and I would anticipate easily breaking bits if I purchased a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. G

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: It’s is strong and wide. I’m 220 lbs and it handles me just fine. It takes a lot of area to swing the legs into place, so that’s awkward inside a tent. Easier to do outside and carry it into the tent. The biggest drawback of this is the stability bars at the top and bottom. They are impossible to get into place unless you use a lever or fulcrum to force it. I set the cot up in the sun to warm and loosen the vinyl and it was easier but I still needed the lever. Will be selling this on Craigslist as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these cots for camping. They are heavy and not suitable for motorcycle or backpacking. I use them for tent camping and they work great. It took about 2 minutes to fully set up. It takes a bit of strength to get the cross piece in but its not too bad. I was impressed with their comfort and stability. I'm 6' 1" and 260 pounds and camped for a week and was comfortable. My grandson used the other cot and had no complaints as well. The price was very reasonable. I don't think think you could get a better cot for three times the price. I would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Phillips

customer_reviews.title: It’s a cot not a trampoline!
customer_reviews.text: It’s exact what I ordered. The 4 stars is because of the weight but I’ll except that because I didn’t pay more to get the lighter cots. I read the reviews and pics about the rips that happen. Tip #1 it’s not a mattress you jump into or plop down on you sit slowly and put one leg up at a time and slowly lay back. The cot is held up by tension and with no support bar in the middle. The cot is for sleep not sex or a bounce party or carrying long distance on your back. Side pockets awesome and quick set up and quick clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy!
customer_reviews.text: These cots are perfect for camping. They are easy to fold and unfold. Note they are HEAVY!!! About 15lbs each. I was afraid of them puncturing the bottom of the tent so we just put down foam puzzle flooring and it was perfect. It was also cold when we went so I got twin sized eggshell foam to put on them and they were perfect. Had it not been cold the regular cot would have been fine.
customer_reviews.author: amanda patterson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight,  great for camping
customer_reviews.text: These are comfy but you really have to be careful putting back in the bag. There are two bars, one for foot area and one for head area that are loose pieces installed after opening cot ( they give it tension) these two pieces when being placed back into bag with cot can rip the cot. If your careful it'll be fine. Just take note of that so you don't do what we did :( and cause a tear.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Campbell

product_meta.title: Coleman Trailhead II Cot
feature_bullets: Elevated comfort: Eliminates the discomfort of sleeping on rough or cold ground
Built to last: Strong cross-bar steel frame
Portable: Folds to fit in most car trunks

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
